meanings.definition: To produce more than (someone or something else)
meanings.sent1: The small bakery is outproducing the big factory.
meanings.sent2: The new machine is outproducing the old one.
meanings.sent3: The ants are outproducing the picnic-goers in food consumption.
meanings.sent4: The student is outproducing all expectations in the science fair project.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower is outproducing the other flowers in the garden with its vibrant blooms.

meanings.sent1: The local farm is outproducing the supermarket in fresh produce.
meanings.sent2: The company is outproducing its competitors in sales this quarter.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel is outproducing the birds in nut gathering.
meanings.sent4: The athlete is outproducing their personal best in every race.
meanings.sent5: The factory is outproducing the demand for its products, leading to surplus inventory.
